( 2 )
You are my first son. Out of the love I have for you, I have acquired the R.C.C. Daba house and land on the vacant land acquired by my ancestors and inherited by me after their lifetime, and thus I have the right to it, which I have built on my own, and which is still in my undisputed possession. I have been paying the Revenue Panchayat taxes. I have given you the following immovable property worth Rs. 8,00,000/- as per the following schedule, free of charge and without any compensation, with all rights and entitlements. I have given you the R.C.C. Daba house and land as per the schedule, this very day. Therefore, from now on, you are the rightful owner of the immovable property as per the schedule and you are the one who should enjoy it freely with full rights of donation and sale, while paying the revenue panchayat taxes. Neither I nor my other heirs have any right to it. This settlement deed is written and given in your name stating that no alienation has been committed in this property. This is a settlement deed given in my name and given in possession of the immovable property. Schedule
Prakash District, Ongole Registration District, Ammanabrolu Sub-District, Ongole Rural

Declaration
As per Ordinance No. 2/77, the property in the Schedule is not an assignment property.
The property in the Schedule is not mortgaged to the Government or its agencies.
There are no structural structures in the property as per the Schedules and we are liable to the action taken by the Department under Sections 27 and 64 of the Indian Stamp Act.
We hereby declare that the property as per the Schedules does not contain any mango, coconut, sweet potato, betel nut or other trees or plantations or any valuable minerals like copper or granite or any valuable mines or any missionary or fish ponds or any other valuable property. We further agree to be liable to the action taken by the Department against us and to pay the depreciation tax if any such material fact is found to be concealed in this document.

boundaries.boundaryN: Executant Second Son Of Property, Name Of Manchu Ramesh

sections.content: The property covered under Gift Settlement Deed No. 105 of 2026 , dated 12/Jan/2026, executed by Manchu Subbayamma in favour of her Son, Manchu Kamalakar towards the property admeasuring an extent of 121 Sq Yds., bearing house number 4-94, Assessment No. 694 (old), Assessment No. 234801000243 (new) comprised in survey no. 395, situated in Ulichi Village and Grama Panchayat, Ongole Rural Mandal, within the District of Prakasam, registered at sub-registrar of Ammanabrolu, is bounded as follows: North by: Executant Second Son Of Property, Name Of Manchu Ramesh South by: Property of Manchu Moshe East by: Panchayathi Road West by: Property of Payanam Anjaiah

As per Registered Documents: 1. The property in survey number 395, bearing house no. 4-94, situated in Ulichi Village, measuring about 121 Sq Yds., was originally owned by Manchu Subbayamma, who acquired the property through inheritance from her ancestors. [Ref: Deed] 2. The aforementioned Manchu Subbayamma, executed a Gift Settlement Deed on 12/Jan/2026, registered as document No. 105 of 2026, before the SRO Ammanabrolu, in favour of her Son, Manchu Kamalakar towards the property admeasuring an extent of 121 Sq Yds,, bearing house number 4-94, Assessment No. 694 (old) Assessment No. 234801000243 (new), comprised in survey no. 395, situated in Ulichi Village. (B) Additional Documents Supporting the Title : The Property Tax Receipt dated 03/Jan/2026, imprinted by the Ulichi Gram Panchayat discloses that Manchu Subbayamma has paid property tax for the period 2025 to 2026, towards house number 4-94, Assessment No. 694 (old), Assessment No. 234801000243 (new).
The HTR attached discloses that Manchu Subbayamma is the taxpayer, hence, it is presumed that the mutation proceedings were not concluded in the name of the current owner Manchu Kamalakar.

contentList: Document Name * Document Description * Document Date * Document Type

sections.content:
We have reviewed the documents provided to us as per the F.I policy and have concluded that the Manchu Kamalakar, possesses a clear, valid, and marketable title to the property measuring 121 Sq Yds.,  bearing house number 4-94,  Assessment No. 694 (old), Assessment No. 234801000243 (new) comprised in survey no. 395, situated in Ulichi Village and Grama Panchayat, Ongole Rural Mandal, within the District of Prakasam, registered at sub-registrar of Ammanabrolu.

Further, the current owner, Manchu Kamalakar is to be added as a party to the loan structure along with the applicant Manchu Sukanya.

Note:: It is to be noted that the online EC has been verified using the Document Number, House Number, Split House Number, Survey Number, and Split Survey Number of the registered SRO as per the Deed. However, verification across multiple SROs has not been carried out in this report due to ongoing EC portal downtime.
